Foods.Colour: Light green, purplish red, darker blueish
Foods.Taste: Sweet and juicy, skin can be chewy
Foods.Structure: Slightly firm on the inside, juicy
Foods.Moisture: Not moist, dry skin on the outside

Nutritional Value.Description: Grapes also have a fair amount of vitamin, B1 (0.069 mg -> 6% of daily value), B2 (0.07 mg -> 6 % of daily value), B6 (0.086 mg -> 7% ofdaily value) & K (14.6 mg -> 14%of daily value)

Foods.Colour: Yellow, sometimes brown spots or markings
Foods.Appearance: Yellow & curved, white on the inside

Nutritional Value.Description:
Bananas also contain a big amount of vitamin B6 (0.4 mg ->31% of daily value), and a fair amountof vitamin C (8.7 mg -> 10% of daily value), vitamin B5 (0.334 mg -> 7% of daily value), vitamin B2 (0.073 mg -> 6% of daily value) and vitamin B9 ( 20 micorog -> 5%of daily value). 
 Bananas are also known for containing fair amounts of certain minerals, like manganese (0.27 mg -> 13% of daily value), magnesium (27 gm -> 8% of daily value) and potassium (358 mg -> 8% of daily value).

Foods.Appearance: Oval & smooth, darker yellow on the inside

Nutritional Value.Description: Mangoes also contain a lot of vitamin C(36.4 mg -> 44% of daily value) & vitamin B9 (43 mg -> 11% of daily value) and a fair amount of vitamin B6 (0.119 mg -> 9% of daily value) and  vitami E (o.9 mg -> 6% of daily value).

Foods.Structure: Slightly firm on the inside, juicy
Foods.Appearance: Heart-shaped to round, red to almost black

Nutritional Value.Description: Cherries also contain a fair amount of vitamin C (7mg -> 8% of daily value). They also contain a fair amount of potassium (222 mg -> 5% of daily valur).

Foods.Shape: Cone shape with a lot of knobs, crown of leaves
Foods.Structure: Slightly firm on the inside, juicy
Foods.Moisture: Not moist, dry skin on the outside
Foods.Appearance: Cone shaped, knobby, crown of leaves, yellow on the inside

Nutritional Value.Description: Pineapples also conatin a large amount of vitamin C (47.8 mg -> 58% of daily value) and a fair amount of vitamin B6 (0.112 mg -> 9% of daily value), B1 (0.079 mg -> 7% of daily value) and B9 (18 mg -> 5% of daily value).

Foods.Structure: Slightly firm on the inside, juicy
Foods.Moisture: Not moist, dry skin on the outside

Nutritional Value.Description: Apricots also contain a lot of vitamin A (96 mg -> 12% of daily value) and vitamin C (10 mg -> 12% of daily value). They also contain a fair amount of vitamin E(0.89 mg -> 6% of daily value) and vitamin B5( 0.24 mg -> 5% of daily value).
